hi and welcome you listening to the x12
report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1348 a and today's date is
August 3rd 2017 and the top of the
episode is the economy breaks down as
the transitional shift is quietly being
implemented let's get into the economic
collapse financial news now as we watch
the stock market hit 20 2005 thousand
points maybe 30 thousand points it
really doesn't matter because when
something is manipulated when the Swiss
central bank when the Japanese bank when
the Fed are manipulating the stock
market it's really absolutely
meaningless and when we look at what is
really going on in the economy we can
see that things are breaking down very
very quickly now we talked about the
Toronto real estate market before and
what we're seeing right now is that the
whole entire market well it's starting
to fall apart now the Toronto real
estate board reported that July home
prices in Canada
well they suffered their biggest monthly
drum on record and we could see at this
point that the prices have dropped by
four point six percent and more
troubling than the prices the price
gigantic price drop is that the buyers
and sellers they're disagreeing about
fair clearing prices and right now
transactions have tumbled by forty point
four percent and this is the biggest
year-over-year decline since 2009 and we
know what happened in 2009 when we look
at Manhattan when we look at San
Francisco when we look at all the major
cities well we're going to see huge
problems in the real estate market in
these cities the reason why is because a
lot of these purchases have been have
been made by foreign investors have been
made by hedge funds investment companies
they haven't been made by the everyday
American or the wealthy American and
what happens when a foreign
country decides you know what we're
going to implement new rules and it cuts
off the spicket of money flowing into
the United States well this is what
we're seeing right now the Chinese
government latest crackdown on capital
outflows and corporate leverage well
it's intensifying right now and that's
really bad news for these big cities
like Manhattan now these new
restrictions that are being imposed on a
lot of these different Chinese companies
well they will likely lead to an 84
percent drop in Chinese overseas
property investment this year and a
further 18 percent most likely by 2018
now the markets that are most vulnerable
to this slowdown is the u.s. the UK Hong
Kong Australia with commercial
properties the most valuable now
Manhattan commercial real estate prices
could fall by quite a bit here and
they're worried that these prices might
fall by 30 percent if they pull out from
these markets and we see at this point
that if this does happen and is already
started it's going to be a complete
disaster and the real estate market is
going to implode now we understand that
the banks have been out there saying
that listen we can't lend to the people
because you know we just don't have
enough funds to do this and if Congress
would just you know remove some of the
restrictions this would just really help
us out now the FDIC vice-chairman thomas
hoening he is in front of the Senate
Banking Committee and he's saying that
this is absolute nonsense the banks are
full of it he said if the bank's wanted
to increase lending they could easily do
so without lower capital requirements
and he pointed out something very
interesting that the ten largest bank
holding companies in the u.s. plowed
over 100 percent of their earnings into
the share buybacks and dividends if they
had retained more of their income they
could have boosted
lending by one trillion dollars but that
would be a problem because all of this
created currency out of thin air that
the Fed is doing that would enter the
public domain if that entered the public
domain guess what there be more dollars
in circulation that means we would have
inflation this is why they told the
bank's buy back your stock pump it into
the stock market pump up the stock
market so he was looking at the entire
banking system as he was telling the
Senate and he said that listen these
banks they could be lending right now
has nothing to do with regulations the
largest banks on his list JPMorgan Chase
earned around 26 billion over the four
quarters but a ploughed 27 point six
billion or a hundred percent 106 percent
of his income into the share buybacks
and dividends if it retained that income
it would have raised its capital by that
amount and it would have been enough to
make an additional 250 billion of loans
under current capital rules and he's
looking at this and saying that all of
these banks are full of it they just
want deregulation right now they could
be lending out with no problem but
remember the central banking system is
controlling what they are doing now we
know the central bank they're creating
currency out of thin air and they know
that if this currency because they
created a lot if it hits the public this
would be a huge problem this is why
they've been keeping it within the
system which it benefits the stock
market it benefits the banks it benefits
the elite not the everyday person so we
see right now that what the banks are
saying well it's turning out to be a
complete lie we see that the US services
economy they have crashed 211 month lows
and we see the is M which is the service
industry that is collapse new orders are
collapsing and we can see manufacturing
is collapsing the sir
versus industry that is collapsing and
we need to understand that all of this
is part of the same exact thing now
remember the economy has been shifting
into different areas because as the
economy economy breaks down and as the
deep state the central bank's continue
continually moved everything overseas
well they had it come up with some type
of explanation of why the economy looks
the way it is and why it's functioning
the way it is
think about it when Nixon took us off
the gold standard they made up the
excuse that they were speculators and
now we come to understand that this had
nothing to do with speculators this had
to do with countries who wanted their
goal back this had to do with the United
States coming off the gold standard and
going on to the petrodollar system so we
see the same thing happening right now
the economy is shifting into many
different areas because as it breaks
down they have to explain away why this
is all happening why we lost a
manufacturing why the service economy is
not doing well why the housing market is
not doing well why we're in this
illusion and they're going to
continually do this in to the very very
end now we have visit debt ceiling
coming up and we know it's coming up
very very soon as the end of September
we know that Congress is going on
vacation they don't return until after
Labor Day and we can see at this point
it doesn't really matter what they do
it's too late for that it's like saying
to a household who's bringing in $50,000
a year and has $500,000 worth of debt
saying hey listen at this point we're
going to put a debt ceiling and you're
not going to be able to do anything well
they have $500,000 debt they cannot meet
the everyday payment of the $500,000
debt yeah they can't take out more but
guess what they're going to have to
eventually do they're going to have to
declare bankruptcy to reset what they
have here because the $50,000 coming in
is just not enough this is what we're
seeing this is what's happening right
now in the country the amount of debt
and the fake unemployment numbers
well they give the illusion that we're
at full employment but when you look at
the tax receipts you see that the tax
receipts
well they don't even cover what the
government is spending and it doesn't
even cover how much we owe on the loans
which goes back to the Fed so even if
they implement the debt ceiling there's
no way to do anything
people can't still find work people are
working at lower paying jobs and the tax
receipts coming into the federal
government it just doesn't work so
they're going to make this big argument
they're going to go back and forth
eventually they're going to raise the
debt ceiling because they have no other
choice but to do this and the scenario
is always the same but what we see
happening right now is that as they
worry about that instead of worrying
about is this a real economy is the
economy deteriorating no we're doing
fine because we're receiving money free
money from the Fed from foreign entities
from you know corporations this is why
they're so blinded in what's really
going on they're completely out of touch
with real America and when we look at
all these different bubbles and there's
many bubbles all over the place the
student loan bubble the stock market
bubble the bond bubble the the
automobile bubble we're seeing that the
subprime auto loan industry
well this bubble is starting to pop and
we had this back in 2008 and that was
with the housing industry and what we're
seeing is that the value of the
underlying assets in these subprime
securities of the auto loans that are
Pripet that are repackaged the assets
are now falling and we could see that
car sales
they are slowing right now and even
worse the total vehicle sales they have
rolled over and this is happening
despite ridiculous offer such as 0% down
and interest refinancing and this is a
major warning that the credit cycle is
once again turning so when we look at
this we can see that yes sales are down
the underlying values in these
securities they're garbage once again
because they're made up of subprime
individuals the bubble is bur
thing right now and it's going to get
worse before it gets better
and this time we're going to see that
this time we're going to have to go
through this transition the stimulus
from the central bank which they're
going to do and the most likely going to
lower the rates quite a bit this is not
going to help the economy because the
real economy well it's completely
falling apart at this point they might
try helicopter money where they just say
here take the free money take the free
money spend it but most people I think I
know for myself are just going to use it
just to live on if they actually do this
and once again
this money will also be taxed so this is
going to turn out to be a no situation
it might look great in the beginning but
a couple months down the line it's going
to completely fall apart because it will
not be able to support the entire
economy it will be completely impossible
now Trump is out there and he is ready
to launch trade war with China and
Beijing of course is saying listen we're
going to retaliate against the United
States if they start to do this now when
we really look at this if Trump really
goes through with this trade war with
China who do you think is going to be
the winner and who do you really think
is going to be the loser or is this
really being set up for the transition
because right now we need to have a jolt
and shock to the system now think about
this for a second yes the US has the
reserve currency of the world but the US
doesn't really produce that much who is
the manufacturing powerhouse when you go
to stores most of the products they made
in China now if the United States goes
ahead and they implement tariffs
sanctions and they start this trade war
and China decides to follow through and
say you know something you want to play
we're going to place sanctions tariffs
or do whatever they need to do
on the United States on every piece of
product that we create well all the
products that we import they come to a
screeching halt the majority of them
it's going to hurt the businesses here
in the United States it's not going to
hurt China China has the rest of the
world to deliver their manufactured
products yes they might slow a little
bit but you think Walmart's going to do
well no a lot of people out of work
you think K Mart's going to do well
while they're already doing poorly how
about all the other chain stores when
you look at the tag most of it is made
right there
it's going to hurt the retail industry
we consume right now we don't produce
China produces they can outlast the
United States in this war now I think
Trump understands this and I think what
he's trying to do at this point is he's
trying to jolt the system and bring back
manufacturing because eventually this is
going to happen if we stop importing
from China he's going to force everyone
to create things here to survive right
because he knows China is going to
create or push through different types
of sanctions if they go that far and the
United States at that point has no other
choice but to start producing because
one way or another I mean this economy
is not going to last we've we've already
seen all the red flags reverse we've
seen all the signs and it's going to be
a complete disaster and when it does hit
and we have no manufacturing here I mean
he tried he tried to make deals with
different corporations but in there
going to those countries that have
hardly any regulations they're going to
those countries that have tax Ben
it's they're going to those countries
that are giving other benefits and the
United States has nothing to offer right
now this is why all these companies left
actually this was created by the central
bank the deep state and it pretty much
forced all these countries all these
companies out of the country now this
was being done on purpose because what
their plan was for the future was to
have this one-world type of system where
all the countries were the same and to
bring the United States down to a
certain level they had to get rid of a
lot of manufacturing and this is what
they've been in the process of doing now
we're trying to reverse this at the last
moment and this is going to be a little
difficult and a lot of people don't
understand what is going on because
they've been you know in the dark all
this time they think the economy's
fantastic stock markets going up this
will last forever a lot of people
thought this in 2008 when they were
owning two three four homes they said
this party's never going to end
we're going to hold on to these houses
we're going to become very very wealthy
because the housing prices are going to
continually move up and up and up a lot
of people thought this they thought
flipping was never going to end I'll
never get hurt with this because real
estate always goes up everything fell
apart the same thing is happening right
now
the difference is there needs to be a
transition because when the system falls
apart this time there's not going to be
stimulus that's going to help the
economy the lower interest rates are not
going to help because they've already
done the damage the real economy is
reeling right now and there's nothing
they can do to fix it yeah they can pump
the banks up they can pretend the stock
market's up to a hundred thousand points
it really is meaningless at the point if
the rest of the country can't do
anything so we all need to be ready we
know the transition is coming and it's
quietly being done right now it might
not be obvious to many people but all of
these things need to be done and of
course the deep state what they're doing
is they're trying to stop it at every
turn they don't
want this to happen and this is why you
see everything this is why you see this
battle being fought right in front of us
this is why it's all over the corporate
media this is why when Trump tries to do
something they try to block him this is
why they make it seem like it's not that
good and I'm not saying that Trump is a
savior he is there for a specific reason
to transition the entire system into
something completely new that is it he's
not there to do anything else they
already understand how bad the system is
think about it we had two choices here
they needed an outsider I know a lot of
people think that he's an insider but
there's no way that he is an insider at
all they wouldn't be fighting him this
much it wouldn't be necessary did they
fight Obama did they fight Bush did they
fight Clinton no I mean if Clinton was
elected we being more right now TPP
would be passed the entire system would
be a nightmare and we would be a
third-world country we'd be in war and
when we come out of war the whole system
would be nothing that we would want the

back here under the TPP well other
individuals from other countries would

American worker would have to compete
with those workers which would be
completely impossible and we see that
that plan that wouldn't have worked out
well for everyone here in America it
would have worked out well for the elite
it would have worked it well out for the
central bankers it would have worked
well for their plan so they brought

he understands transition he's a
businessman and this is why he's trying
to undo everything that has been done a
lot of people don't see it that way but

now we know one thing for sure that the

it's getting
and you need to be ready and prepared
listen everyone thanks a lot for
